sub_title: Photonics | Biophotonics | Optics | Spectroscopy | Imaging| Data analysis | Machine learning
summary:
Research fellow currently working on developing diagnostic technique for intraoperative assessment of metastasis in lymph nodes.

Proven success in driving the project, planning, execution, and project management with more than 10 years of experience in optics, biophotonics, spectroscopy, imaging, medical devices as evidenced by publications.

Ability to gather and interpret scientific information and implement them in research. Flexibility and adaptability skills acquired by working in different groups and environments.

I have ability to adapt, take lead and strive to my very best. Seeking jobs in industry.

projects.title: Refractive Index Modification in Borosilicate Glasses using Ultrashort Lasers
projects.description:
Project Student: January 2011-June 2011
Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR), Mumbai
Dept. of Atomic and Molecular Physics, MAHE, Manipal

Understanding the working principle of ultrashort lasers and its applications. Aligned Kerr lens mode locking set-up to get pulsed laser. 
Developed the set-up for fabricating microstructures using direct laser writing method and made waveguides and gratings inside BK7 glass

profile_positions.description:
•	Project management - planning and execution of project within time boundaries; coordination between multi-disciplinary teams; mentoring project students; training PhD students
•	Alignment, calibration and optimisation of the instrument combining Raman spectroscopy and fluorescence imaging for assessment of metastasis in lymph nodes
•	Acquisition, processing and analysis of data
•	Development of statistical models for segmentation of autofluorescence images and classification algorithms for Raman spectra using MATLAB
•	Implemented the multispectral imaging technique (MSI) using Raman spectroscopy and 
autofluorescence imaging in the instrument using LabVIEW for detecting metastasis in lymph nodes
•	Scientific writing of the results in the form of reports and publications
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
'Micro-Raman and Surface Enhanced Raman Spectroscopy Study of Blood Components'

The main objective was to optimize parameters of Raman tweezers system to perform Raman spectroscopy and SERS of blood cells and to find possible damage on cells due to the probe laser beam. Ph.D. work involved Raman tweezers spectroscopy study of size dependent silver and gold nanoparticles induced toxicity on red blood cells (RBCs). Suicidal death of erythrocytes, also known as eryptosis due to different conditions such as heat, oxidative stress etc. has also been studied.
profile_positions.title: Ph.D. Student

volunteer_experiences.description: Demonstrating my research lab experiments to B.Sc. students as part of outreach program.
